intro: Matayba talisioides, commonly known as the Talisier tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical climates and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
